content.question: Which of the following correctly notates an A-flat major scale?

choices.label: An ascending scale in bass clef. The pitches are A-flat, B, C, D, E-flat, F, G, and A-flat.
An ascending scale in bass clef. The pitches are A-flat, B-flat, C, D, E-flat, F, G, and A-flat.
An ascending scale in bass clef. The pitches are A-flat, B-flat, C, D-flat, E-flat, F, G, and A-flat.
An ascending scale in bass clef. The pitches are A-flat, B-flat, C, D-flat, E-flat, F, G-flat, and A-flat.

content.answer: An ascending scale in bass clef. The pitches are A-flat, B-flat, C, D-flat, E-flat, F, G, and A-flat.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
